creator: ASFbugzilla@leo.0n3.org
text:
After "Edit Group Affiliation" the "Save"ing doesn't work!
So I always got the old status again.

creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
I am unable to reproduce on zones or from a fresh checkout from svn. What
version are you running? What steps have you done to get this to happen?

The bug is java version related; it only occurs using java 1.6 (I guess, Richard
L. is using 1.6 and Richard F. is using 1.4 or 1.5). I addition to the save
action, the assignment of groups is not working properly under java 1.6, too.
creator: ragaller@apache.org

text: Juergen is right - I was using JRE version 1.6.0. If I switch to 1.5.0 it works!
creator: ASFbugzilla@leo.0n3.org

text: I have located the bug. I will provide documentation and a patch ASAP.
creator: mangst@inventec.ch
mangst@inventec.ch
text:
Created attachment 20484
This patch fixes the bug.

The patch is intended to be temporary. It works for me but it leaves room for
improvement by someone who has more Java knowledge than me.

creator: mangst@inventec.ch
text:
There are other places in the code of Lenya that probably need the same
treatment like this one. Example: calls to GroupMembers.setParameter.

(In reply to comment #6)
> There are other places in the code of Lenya that probably need the same
> treatment like this one. Example: calls to GroupMembers.setParameter.

Thanks for the patch!

We have to find a generic way to handle these cases, though - special treatment
in UsecaseProxy is certainly not an option. I'll take a look at it.
creator: andreas@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
The parameter initialization happens now in initParameters() (where it actually
belongs).

creator: andreas@apache.org
text: It should work now. Please re-open if it still occurs.
